dir=\"auto\"\u003eWrite one minimal test showing what should happen.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n```typescript\ntest('retries failed operations 3 times', async () =\u0026gt; {\n  let attempts = 0;\n  const operation = () =\u0026gt; {\n    attempts++;\n    if (attempts \u0026lt; 3) throw new Error('fail');\n    return 'success';\n  };\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003econst result = await retryOperation(operation);\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eexpect(result).toBe('success');\nexpect(attempts).toBe(3);\n});\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"Clear name, tests real behavior, one thing\n\u0026lt;/Good\u0026gt;\n\n\u0026lt;Bad\u0026gt;\n```typescript\ntest('retry works', async () =\u0026gt; {\n  const mock = jest.fn()\n    .mockRejectedValueOnce(new Error())\n    .mockRejectedValueOnce(new Error())\n    .mockResolvedValueOnce('success');\n  await retryOperation(mock);\n  expect(mock).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);\n});\"\u003e\u003cpre const mock = jest.fn()\n    .mockRejectedValueOnce(new Error())\n    .mockRejectedValueOnce(new Error())\n    .mockResolvedValueOnce('success');\n  await retryOperation(mock);\n Never skip.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"npm test path/to/test.test.ts\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003enpm \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003etest\u003c/span\u003e path/to/test.test.ts\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eConfirm:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eTest fails (not errors)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFailure message is expected\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFails because feature missing (not typos)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eTest passes?\u003c/strong\u003e You're testing existing behavior. Minimal Code\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-green---minimal-code\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: GREEN - Minimal Code\" href=\"#green---minimal-code\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWrite simplest code to pass the test.\u003c/p\u003e\n\n```typescript\nasync function retryOperation(fn: () =\u0026gt; Promise): Promise {\n  for (let i = 0; i \u0026lt; 3; i++) {\n    try {\n      return await fn();\n    } catch (e) {\n      if (i === 2) throw e;\n    }\n  }\n  throw new Error('unreachable');\n}\n```\nJust enough to pass\n\n\n```typescript\nasync function retryOperation(\n  fn: () =\u0026gt; Promise,\n  options?: {\n    maxRetries?: number;\n    backoff?: 'linear' | 'exponential';\n    onRetry?: (attempt: number) =\u0026gt; void;\n  }\n): Promise {\n  // YAGNI\n}\n```\nOver-engineered\n\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDon't add features, refactor other code, or \"improve\" beyond the test.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eVerify GREEN - Passing immediately proves nothing:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMight test wrong thing\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMight test implementation, not behavior\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eMight miss edge cases you forgot\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eYou never saw it catch the bug\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTest-first forces you to see the test fail, proving it actually tests something.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\"I already manually tested all the edge cases\"\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eManual testing is ad-hoc. You think you tested everything but:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eNo record of what you tested\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eCan't re-run when code changes\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEasy to forget cases under pressure\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\"It worked when I tried it\" ≠ comprehensive\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAutomated tests are systematic. They run the same way every time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\"Deleting X hours of work is wasteful\"\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSunk cost fallacy. The time is already gone. Your choice now:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDelete and rewrite with TDD (X more hours, high confidence)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eKeep it and add tests after (30 min, low confidence, likely bugs)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \"waste\" is keeping code you can't trust. Working code without real tests is technical debt.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\"TDD is dogmatic, being pragmatic means adapting\"\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTDD IS pragmatic:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eFinds bugs before commit (faster than debugging after)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ePrevents regressions (tests catch breaks immediately)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eDocuments behavior (tests show how to use code)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eEnables refactoring (change freely, tests catch breaks)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\"Pragmatic\" shortcuts = debugging in production = slower.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e\"Tests after achieve the same goals - it's spirit not ritual\"\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNo. Tests-after answer \"What does this do?\" Tests-first answer \"What should this do?\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTests-after are biased by your implementation. You test what you built, not what's required. You verify remembered edge cases, not discovered ones.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTests-first force edge case discovery before implementing. Tests-after verify you remembered everything (you didn't).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e30 minutes of tests after ≠ TDD. You get coverage, lose proof tests work.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eCommon Rationalizations\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-common-rationalizations\" class=\"anchor\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Common Rationalizations\" href=\"#common-rationalizations\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cmarkdown-accessiblity-table\u003e\u003ctable\u003e\n\u003cthead\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eExcuse\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth\u003eReality\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/thead\u003e\n\u003ctbody\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"Too simple to test\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSimple code breaks. Test takes 30 seconds.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"I'll test after\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eTests passing immediately prove nothing.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"Tests after achieve same goals\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eTests-after = \"what does this do?\" Tests-first = \"what should this do?\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"Already manually tested\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eAd-hoc ≠ systematic. No record, can't re-run.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"Deleting X hours is wasteful\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eSunk cost fallacy. Keeping unverified code is technical debt.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"Keep as reference, write tests first\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eYou'll adapt it. That's testing after. Delete means delete.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"Need to explore first\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eFine. Throw away exploration, start with TDD.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"Test hard = design unclear\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eListen to test. Hard to test = hard to use.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"TDD will slow me down\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eTDD faster than debugging. Pragmatic = test-first.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"Manual test faster\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eManual doesn't prove edge cases. You'll re-test every change.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\"Existing code has no tests\"\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eYou're improving it. <div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Test-Driven Development (TDD)</h1><a id="user-content-test-driven-development-tdd" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Test-Driven Development (TDD)" href="#test-driven-development-tdd"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Overview</h2><a id="user-content-overview" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Overview" href="#overview"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Write the test first. Watch it fail. Write minimal code to pass.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Core principle:</strong> If you didn't watch the test fail, you don't know if it tests the right thing.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Violating the letter of the rules is violating the spirit of the rules.</strong></p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">When to Use</h2><a id="user-content-when-to-use" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: When to Use" href="#when-to-use"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Always:</strong></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>New features</li>
<li>Bug fixes</li>
<li>Refactoring</li>
<li>Behavior changes</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Exceptions (ask your human partner):</strong></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Throwaway prototypes</li>
<li>Generated code</li>
<li>Configuration files</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">Thinking "skip TDD just this once"? Stop. That's rationalization.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">The Iron Law</h2><a id="user-content-the-iron-law" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: The Iron Law" href="#the-iron-law"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="NO PRODUCTION CODE WITHOUT A FAILING TEST FIRST"><pre class="notranslate"><code>NO PRODUCTION CODE WITHOUT A FAILING TEST FIRST
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Write code before the test? Delete it. Start over.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>No exceptions:</strong></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Don't keep it as "reference"</li>
<li>Don't "adapt" it while writing tests</li>
<li>Don't look at it</li>
<li>Delete means delete</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">Implement fresh from tests. Period.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Red-Green-Refactor</h2><a id="user-content-red-green-refactor" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Red-Green-Refactor" href="#red-green-refactor"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-dot notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="digraph tdd_cycle {
    rankdir=LR;
    red [label=&quot;RED\nWrite failing test&quot;, shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=&quot;#ffcccc&quot;];
    verify_red [label=&quot;Verify fails\ncorrectly&quot;, shape=diamond];
    green [label=&quot;GREEN\nMinimal code&quot;, shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=&quot;#ccffcc&quot;];
    verify_green [label=&quot;Verify passes\nAll green&quot;, shape=diamond];
    refactor [label=&quot;REFACTOR\nClean up&quot;, shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=&quot;#ccccff&quot;];
    next [label=&quot;Next&quot;, shape=ellipse];

    red -&gt; verify_red;
    verify_red -&gt; green [label=&quot;yes&quot;];
    verify_red -&gt; red [label=&quot;wrong\nfailure&quot;];
    green -&gt; verify_green;
    verify_green -&gt; refactor [label=&quot;yes&quot;];
    verify_green -&gt; green [label=&quot;no&quot;];
    refactor -&gt; verify_green [label=&quot;stay\ngreen&quot;];
    verify_green -&gt; next;
    next -&gt; red;
}"><pre><span class="pl-k">digraph</span> tdd_cycle {
    <span class="pl-c1">rankdir</span>=LR;

    verify_red [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Verify fails<span class="pl-cce">\n</span>correctly<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-c1">shape</span>=<span class="pl-smi">diamond</span>];
    green [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>GREEN<span class="pl-cce">\n</span>Minimal code<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-c1">shape</span>=<span class="pl-smi">box</span>, <span class="pl-c1">style</span>=filled, <span class="pl-c1">fillcolor</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>#ccffcc<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>];
    verify_green [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Verify passes<span class="pl-cce">\n</span>All green<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-c1">shape</span>=<span class="pl-smi">diamond</span>];
    refactor [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>REFACTOR<span class="pl-cce">\n</span>Clean up<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-c1">shape</span>=<span class="pl-smi">box</span>, <span class="pl-c1">style</span>=filled, <span class="pl-c1">fillcolor</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>#ccccff<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>];
    next [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Next<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-c1">shape</span>=<span class="pl-smi">ellipse</span>];

    red <span class="pl-k">-&gt;</span> verify_red;
    verify_red <span class="pl-k">-&gt;</span> green [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>yes<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>];
    verify_red <span class="pl-k">-&gt;</span> red [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>wrong<span class="pl-cce">\n</span>failure<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>];
    green <span class="pl-k">-&gt;</span> verify_green;
    verify_green <span class="pl-k">-&gt;</span> refactor [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>yes<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>];
    verify_green <span class="pl-k">-&gt;</span> green [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>no<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>];
    refactor <span class="pl-k">-&gt;</span> verify_green [<span class="pl-c1">label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>stay<span class="pl-cce">\n</span>green<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>];
    verify_green <span class="pl-k">-&gt;</span> next;
    next <span class="pl-k">-&gt;</span> red;
}</pre></div>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">RED - Write Failing Test</h3><a id="user-content-red---write-failing-test" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: RED - Write Failing Test" href="#red---write-failing-test"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Write one minimal test showing what should happen.</p>

```typescript
test('retries failed operations 3 times', async () =&gt; {
  let attempts = 0;
  const operation = () =&gt; {
    attempts++;
    if (attempts &lt; 3) throw new Error('fail');
    return 'success';
  };
<p dir="auto">const result = await retryOperation(operation);</p>
<p dir="auto">expect(result).toBe('success');
expect(attempts).toBe(3);
});</p>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Clear name, tests real behavior, one thing
&lt;/Good&gt;

&lt;Bad&gt;
```typescript
test('retry works', async () =&gt; {
  const mock = jest.fn()
    .mockRejectedValueOnce(new Error())
    .mockRejectedValueOnce(new Error())
    .mockResolvedValueOnce('success');
  await retryOperation(mock);
  expect(mock).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);
});"><pre class="notranslate"><code>Clear name, tests real behavior, one thing
&lt;/Good&gt;

&lt;Bad&gt;
```typescript
test('retry works', async () =&gt; {
  const mock = jest.fn()
    .mockRejectedValueOnce(new Error())
    .mockRejectedValueOnce(new Error())
    .mockResolvedValueOnce('success');
  await retryOperation(mock);
  expect(mock).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);
});
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Vague name, tests mock not code
</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>One behavior</li>
<li>Clear name</li>
<li>Real code (no mocks unless unavoidable)</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Verify RED - Watch It Fail</h3><a id="user-content-verify-red---watch-it-fail" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Verify RED - Watch It Fail" href="#verify-red---watch-it-fail"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>MANDATORY. Never skip.</strong></p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="npm test path/to/test.test.ts"><pre>npm <span class="pl-c1">test</span> path/to/test.test.ts</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Confirm:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Test fails (not errors)</li>
<li>Failure message is expected</li>
<li>Fails because feature missing (not typos)</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Test passes?</strong> You're testing existing behavior. Fix test.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Test errors?</strong> Fix error, re-run until it fails correctly.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">GREEN - Minimal Code</h3><a id="user-content-green---minimal-code" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: GREEN - Minimal Code" href="#green---minimal-code"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Write simplest code to pass the test.</p>

```typescript
async function retryOperation(fn: () =&gt; Promise): Promise {
  for (let i = 0; i &lt; 3; i++) {
    try {
      return await fn();
    } catch (e) {
      if (i === 2) throw e;
    }
  }
  throw new Error('unreachable');
}
```
Just enough to pass


```typescript
async function retryOperation(
  fn: () =&gt; Promise,
  options?: {
    maxRetries?: number;
    backoff?: 'linear' | 'exponential';
    onRetry?: (attempt: number) =&gt; void;
  }
): Promise {
  // YAGNI
}
```
Over-engineered

<p dir="auto">Don't add features, refactor other code, or "improve" beyond the test.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Verify GREEN - Watch It Pass</h3><a id="user-content-verify-green---watch-it-pass" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Verify GREEN - Watch It Pass" href="#verify-green---watch-it-pass"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>MANDATORY.</strong></p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="npm test path/to/test.test.ts"><pre>npm <span class="pl-c1">test</span> path/to/test.test.ts</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Confirm:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Test passes</li>
<li>Other tests still pass</li>
<li>Output pristine (no errors, warnings)</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Test fails?</strong> Fix code, not test.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Other tests fail?</strong> Fix now.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">REFACTOR - Clean Up</h3><a id="user-content-refactor---clean-up" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: REFACTOR - Clean Up" href="#refactor---clean-up"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">After green only:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Remove duplication</li>
<li>Improve names</li>
<li>Extract helpers</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">Keep tests green. Don't add behavior.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Repeat</h3><a id="user-content-repeat" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Repeat" href="#repeat"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Next failing test for next feature.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Good Tests</h2><a id="user-content-good-tests" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Good Tests" href="#good-tests"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<markdown-accessiblity-table><table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Quality</th>
<th>Good</th>
<th>Bad</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td><strong>Minimal</strong></td>
<td>One thing. "and" in name? Split it.</td>
<td><code>test('validates email and domain and whitespace')</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Clear</strong></td>
<td>Name describes behavior</td>
<td><code>test('test1')</code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Shows intent</strong></td>
<td>Demonstrates desired API</td>
<td>Obscures what code should do</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></markdown-accessiblity-table>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Why Order Matters</h2><a id="user-content-why-order-matters" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Why Order Matters" href="#why-order-matters"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>"I'll write tests after to verify it works"</strong></p>
<p dir="auto">Tests written after code pass immediately. Passing immediately proves nothing:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Might test wrong thing</li>
<li>Might test implementation, not behavior</li>
<li>Might miss edge cases you forgot</li>
<li>You never saw it catch the bug</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">Test-first forces you to see the test fail, proving it actually tests something.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>"I already manually tested all the edge cases"</strong></p>
<p dir="auto">Manual testing is ad-hoc. You think you tested everything but:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>No record of what you tested</li>
<li>Can't re-run when code changes</li>
<li>Easy to forget cases under pressure</li>
<li>"It worked when I tried it" ≠ comprehensive</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">Automated tests are systematic. They run the same way every time.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>"Deleting X hours of work is wasteful"</strong></p>
<p dir="auto">Sunk cost fallacy. The time is already gone. Your choice now:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Delete and rewrite with TDD (X more hours, high confidence)</li>
<li>Keep it and add tests after (30 min, low confidence, likely bugs)</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">The "waste" is keeping code you can't trust. Working code without real tests is technical debt.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>"TDD is dogmatic, being pragmatic means adapting"</strong></p>
<p dir="auto">TDD IS pragmatic:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Finds bugs before commit (faster than debugging after)</li>
<li>Prevents regressions (tests catch breaks immediately)</li>
<li>Documents behavior (tests show how to use code)</li>
<li>Enables refactoring (change freely, tests catch breaks)</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">"Pragmatic" shortcuts = debugging in production = slower.</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>"Tests after achieve the same goals - it's spirit not ritual"</strong></p>
<p dir="auto">No. Tests-after answer "What does this do?" Tests-first answer "What should this do?"</p>
<p dir="auto">Tests-after are biased by your implementation. You test what you built, not what's required. You verify remembered edge cases, not discovered ones.</p>
<p dir="auto">Tests-first force edge case discovery before implementing. Tests-after verify you remembered everything (you didn't).</p>
<p dir="auto">30 minutes of tests after ≠ TDD. You get coverage, lose proof tests work.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Common Rationalizations</h2><a id="user-content-common-rationalizations" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Common Rationalizations" href="#common-rationalizations"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<markdown-accessiblity-table><table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Excuse</th>
<th>Reality</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>"Too simple to test"</td>
<td>Simple code breaks. Test takes 30 seconds.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"I'll test after"</td>
<td>Tests passing immediately prove nothing.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"Tests after achieve same goals"</td>
<td>Tests-after = "what does this do?" Tests-first = "what should this do?"</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"Already manually tested"</td>
<td>Ad-hoc ≠ systematic. No record, can't re-run.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"Deleting X hours is wasteful"</td>
<td>Sunk cost fallacy. Keeping unverified code is technical debt.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"Keep as reference, write tests first"</td>
<td>You'll adapt it. That's testing after. Delete means delete.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"Need to explore first"</td>
<td>Fine. Throw away exploration, start with TDD.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"Test hard = design unclear"</td>
<td>Listen to test. Hard to test = hard to use.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"TDD will slow me down"</td>
<td>TDD faster than debugging. Pragmatic = test-first.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"Manual test faster"</td>
<td>Manual doesn't prove edge cases. You'll re-test every change.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>"Existing code has no tests"</td>
<td>You're improving it. Add tests for existing code.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></markdown-accessiblity-table>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Red Flags - STOP and Start Over</h2><a id="user-content-red-flags---stop-and-start-over" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Red Flags - STOP and Start Over" href="#red-flags---stop-and-start-over"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Code before test</li>
<li>Test after implementation</li>
<li>Test passes immediately</li>
<li>Can't explain why test failed</li>
<li>Tests added "later"</li>
<li>Rationalizing "just this once"</li>
<li>"I already manually tested it"</li>
<li>"Tests after achieve the same purpose"</li>
<li>"It's about spirit not ritual"</li>
<li>"Keep as reference" or "adapt existing code"</li>
<li>"Already spent X hours, deleting is wasteful"</li>
<li>"TDD is dogmatic, I'm being pragmatic"</li>
<li>"This is different because..."</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto"><strong>All of these mean: Delete code. Start over with TDD.</strong></p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Example: Bug Fix</h2><a id="user-content-example-bug-fix" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Example: Bug Fix" href="#example-bug-fix"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Bug:</strong> Empty email accepted</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>RED</strong></p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="test('rejects empty email', async () =&gt; {
  const result = await submitForm({ email: '' });
  expect(result.error).toBe('Email required');
});"><pre><span class="pl-en">test</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'rejects empty email'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-k">async</span> <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c1">=&gt;</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">result</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">await</span> <span class="pl-en">submitForm</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">email</span>: <span class="pl-s">''</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>
  <span class="pl-en">expect</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">result</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">error</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">toBe</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'Email required'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Verify RED</strong></p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ npm test
FAIL: expected 'Email required', got undefined"><pre>$ npm <span class="pl-c1">test</span>
FAIL: expected <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Email required<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, got undefined</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>GREEN</strong></p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-ts notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="function submitForm(data: FormData) {
  if (!data.email?.trim()) {
    return { error: 'Email required' };
  }
  // ...
}"><pre><span class="pl-k">function</span> <span class="pl-en">submitForm</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">data</span>: <span class="pl-smi">FormData</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-c1">!</span><span class="pl-s1">data</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">email</span><span class="pl-kos">?.</span><span class="pl-en">trim</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
    <span class="pl-k">return</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">error</span>: <span class="pl-s">'Email required'</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>
  <span class="pl-kos">}</span>
  <span class="pl-c">// ...</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>Verify GREEN</strong></p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ npm test
PASS"><pre>$ npm <span class="pl-c1">test</span>
PASS</pre></div>
<p dir="auto"><strong>REFACTOR</strong>
Extract validation for multiple fields if needed.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Verification Checklist</h2><a id="user-content-verification-checklist" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Verification Checklist" href="#verification-checklist"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Before marking work complete:</p>
<ul class="contains-task-list">
<li class="task-list-item"><input type="checkbox" id="" disabled="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" aria-label="Incomplete task"> Every new function/method has a test</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input type="checkbox" id="" disabled="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" aria-label="Incomplete task"> Watched each test fail before implementing</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input type="checkbox" id="" disabled="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" aria-label="Incomplete task"> Each test failed for expected reason (feature missing, not typo)</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input type="checkbox" id="" disabled="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" aria-label="Incomplete task"> Wrote minimal code to pass each test</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input type="checkbox" id="" disabled="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" aria-label="Incomplete task"> All tests pass</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input type="checkbox" id="" disabled="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" aria-label="Incomplete task"> Output pristine (no errors, warnings)</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input type="checkbox" id="" disabled="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" aria-label="Incomplete task"> Tests use real code (mocks only if unavoidable)</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input type="checkbox" id="" disabled="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" aria-label="Incomplete task"> Edge cases and errors covered</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto">Can't check all boxes? You skipped TDD. Start over.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">When Stuck</h2><a id="user-content-when-stuck" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: When Stuck" href="#when-stuck"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<markdown-accessiblity-table><table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Problem</th>
<th>Solution</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Don't know how to test</td>
<td>Write wished-for API. Write assertion first. Ask your human partner.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Test too complicated</td>
<td>Design too complicated. Simplify interface.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Must mock everything</td>
<td>Code too coupled. Use dependency injection.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Test setup huge</td>
<td>Extract helpers. Still complex? Simplify design.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></markdown-accessiblity-table>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Debugging Integration</h2><a id="user-content-debugging-integration" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Debugging Integration" href="#debugging-integration"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">Bug found? Write failing test reproducing it. Follow TDD cycle. Test proves fix and prevents regression.</p>
<p dir="auto">Never fix bugs without a test.</p>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Testing Anti-Patterns</h2><a id="user-content-testing-anti-patterns" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Testing Anti-Patterns" href="#testing-anti-patterns"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<p dir="auto">When adding mocks or test utilities, read @testing-anti-patterns.md to avoid common pitfalls:</p>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Testing mock behavior instead of real behavior</li>
<li>Adding test-only methods to production classes</li>
<li>Mocking without understanding dependencies</li>
</ul>
<div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Final Rule</h2><a id="user-content-final-rule" class="anchor" aria-label="Permalink: Final Rule" href="#final-rule"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div>
<div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="Production code → test exists and failed first
Otherwise → not TDD"><pre class="notranslate"><code>Production code → test exists and failed first
Otherwise → not TDD
</code></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">No exceptions without your human partner's permission.</p>
